name: Blind Bouncer: A Story
description:
Blind Bouncer: A Story is a casual text-based number puzzle adventure game in which you follow the story of the Blind Bouncer on his quest to heal his eyes by taking decisions and try to keep the bars you work at safe.

The game has math-puzzle like day quests; accept or refuse clients while trying to reach the daily goals. As you can't really see what is going on, use your senses to be able to decide who to let in, who to reject. While Blind Bouncer: A Story has no branching narrative, it has several different endings.

You will probably not reach the desired ending the first run.

The story has many alternate fiction elements and some references that would help players visualize scenes by referring to their movie and book memories.

The game is developed by a single developer, me, who thought of gamifying a story that I wrote. By no means it is a fully developed game that has "cool" features. It is a very simple game that will catch you with its story or not.

Blind Bouncer: A Story first launched on a mobile platform but the Windows and Mac port does not have any ads or in-game purchases; it is completely free.

Soon I will release another game which will be a more in-depth developed game please sign up to my mailing list in-game or from the Worthy Game website.

I hope you enjoy the game.

Cheers.

Features

- Many different endings.

- Math-puzzle like advancement.

- Movie and book references.

- Approx. 10k words story.

- Nice song.

- Simple but different.
